intro: Chrysanthemum breviradiatum, commonly known as the narrow-rayed chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow central disks and white to pale yellow ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in temperate climates. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its delicate appearance and ability to bloom in late summer to early autumn. The species is also valued in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
